Description of incident: The Wake County school system accidentally sent out about 5,000 postcards with students' Social Security Numbers printed on the front. Wake schools mailed about 15,000 reminders asking parents to specify if they want to keep their children in magnet or traditional calendar schools. About a third of those cards had the Social Security Numbers printed alongside the child's name - a holdover from recent years when those nine-digit numbers were used to identify students.
